questions.question: What are the characteristics of ZigBee in IoT networks?
Which of the following are common applications of WSNs?
What are some of the key advantages of using WSNs over traditional wired sensor networks?
options: Higher power consumption than wired networks.

questions.question: Which improvements does IEEE 802.11ac introduce over older Wi-Fi standards?
options: Multi-User MIMO (MU-MIMO) for parallel data transmission.
Support for operation in the 900 MHz band.

questions.question: Which IEEE 802.15 working group standards are relevant to WPANs?
options: IEEE 802.15.4 (Low data rate and power-efficient networks).

questions.question: What are the main differences between mesh-under and route-over routing in 6LoWPAN?
options: Mesh-under routing is managed at the data link layer.
Route-over routing allows each hop to be an IP router.
Route-over routing results in simpler packet forwarding.
Mesh-under routing incurs more traffic within a single domain.

questions.question: Which factors influence the reading range of an RFID system?
What are the key types of RFID tags?
Which factors affect signal propagation in wireless IoT networks?
Which of the following describe key attributes of Z-Wave technology?
options: Operates in the sub-1 GHz frequency band.
Supports a maximum of four routing hops.
Uses a single primary controller to manage the network.
Requires a full IP stack for communication.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of RFID over barcodes?
What are the main layers in the WSN protocol stack?
Which characteristics differentiate IEEE 802.11ah (Wi-Fi HaLow) from traditional Wi-Fi?
options: Operates in sub-1 GHz frequency bands.
Supports thousands of IoT devices per access point.
Uses narrower channels to increase range.

questions.question: Which factors determine the reliability of an IoT network?
What are key considerations when designing IoT network protocols?
options: Scalability to support a large number of devices.
Use of only wired communication for reliability.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered Application Layer protocols in IoT?
Which of the following are key differences between FDD and TDD in LTE?
options: FDD uses separate frequency bands for uplink and downlink.
TDD shares the same frequency band for uplink and downlink.
FDD is more suitable for symmetric traffic loads.
TDD is more efficient for asymmetric data traffic, such as in IoT.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of Non-IP based WPAN communication?
options: Optimized for cost and energy efficiency.
Requires a full IP stack for connectivity.
Typically operates within short to medium range.

questions.question: What are key advantages of using LoRaWAN for IoT?
What are key considerations when designing wireless IoT networks?
Which factors influence RF signal quality in WPAN communication?
Which networking layers are commonly adapted in IoT environments?
Which wireless IoT technology is best suited for ultra-low-power applications?
Which of the following are key characteristics of WSN architecture?
Which of the following are key characteristics of LTE-M (Cat-M1)?
options: Allows mobility and handover between cells.
Uses ultra-narrowband channels for minimal interference.

questions.question: Which of the following are essential components of a Wireless Sensor Network (WSN)?
Which challenges affect the deployment of WSNs?
options: High computational power in sensor nodes.

questions.question: Which IoT protocols support IP networking for low-power devices?
Which of the following statements about 5G and IoT are correct?
options: 5G includes specific standards optimized for massive IoT (mMTC).
5G operates only on millimeter wave (mmWave) frequencies.
5G networks offer higher energy efficiency than 4G LTE for IoT devices.

questions.question: Which of the following are fundamental aspects of communication in IoT?
options: Hardware components such as wires and transmitters.
Nature of transmission such as electromagnetic waves.

questions.question: Which protocols are typically used at the Network Layer in IoT?
Which factors impact the efficiency of a 6LoWPAN mesh network?
options: Edge router efficiency in handling IPv6 compression.
The number of hops required for data to reach the internet.
The type of routing scheme used (mesh-under vs. route-over).
Whether devices are statically assigned IPv6 addresses.

questions.question: What functions does the Data Link Layer serve in IoT communication?
options: Establishes a basic handshake between nodes.
Encodes physical signal changes into a bit stream.
Provides addressing and routing for data packets.
Defines the physical characteristics of network cables.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about 6LoWPAN are correct?
options: It allows constrained devices to communicate using IPv6.
It requires a full TCP/IP stack for operation.
It supports both mesh and star topologies.
It is optimized for low-power and lossy networks.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of Zigbee over Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)?
options: Better scalability in large mesh networks.
Lower power consumption for continuous operation.
More efficient handling of broadcast messaging.

questions.question: Which challenges are associated with Non-IP WPAN technologies?
options: Security vulnerabilities due to lower encryption standards.
Higher power consumption compared to IP-based solutions.

questions.question: Which features of IPv6 are particularly useful for IoT?
options: Vast address space allowing unique addresses for billions of devices.
Header compression to improve efficiency in low-power networks.

questions.question: How does the Transport Layer contribute to IoT communication?
options: It determines how packets are routed through the network.
It assigns unique IP addresses to data packets.
It ensures data integrity and proper sequencing of messages.
It establishes and maintains session connections.

questions.question: Which of the following LPWAN technologies operates in the licensed spectrum?
Which of the following standards are relevant for RFID technology?
Which layers are included in the OSI model for IoT communication?
What are the primary challenges of deploying LoRaWAN networks?
options: Lack of support for real-time applications.
Coverage constraints in dense urban areas.

questions.question: Which challenges arise when implementing IP in IoT sensor networks?
options: High processing overhead for small devices.
Power consumption due to constant connectivity requirements.
Increased security risks from global addressability.
Simplified network configuration compared to proprietary protocols.

questions.question: What are key characteristics of the Electronic Product Code (EPC)?
options: Provides a unique identifier for tagged objects.
Enables object tracking across supply chains.
Requires a direct internet connection for functionality.

questions.question: Which wireless communication technologies are widely used in IoT?
Which of the following best describe the advantages of NB-IoT over traditional cellular networks?
What are the advantages of using the Device-to-Cloud communication model?
Which are the three main IoT communication models?
Which of the following are critical trade-offs in IoT network design?
Which of the following security risks are associated with RFID?
options: Cloning and spoofing of RFID tags.

questions.question: What are common constraints of IoT network devices?
Which IEEE standards define wireless communication protocols relevant to IoT?
Which of the following are common applications of RFID?
What role does WSN middleware play in sensor networks?
options: Provides system scalability and fault tolerance.
Acts as a standalone WSN control system.

questions.question: Which of the following are essential components of an RFID system?
Which of the following factors influence the choice of a wireless standard for IoT?
Which of the following networking topologies is most scalable for large-scale IoT deployments?
Which security mechanisms are commonly used in WPANs?
options: Adaptive Frequency Hopping (AFH) to mitigate interference.

questions.question: Which WPAN topologies are commonly used in Bluetooth and Zigbee networks?
Which of the following technologies support IP-to-the-edge architecture in IoT?
Which of the following are advantages of using Bluetooth 5.0 over previous Bluetooth versions?
Which challenges are associated with wireless IoT communication?
options: Security risks due to open-air transmission.
High power consumption in long-range communications.

questions.question: How does the TCP/IP model differ from the OSI model?
options: The TCP/IP model has fewer layers.
The OSI model is more theoretical, whereas TCP/IP is more practical.
TCP/IP combines multiple OSI layers into broader categories.
The OSI model does not support IoT applications.
